Literature.Title: BaCf3: highly thermostable bacteriocin from Bacillus amyloliquefaciens BTSS3 antagonistic on food-borne pathogens.
Literature.Author: Bindiya ES, Tina KJ, Sasidharan RS, Bhat SG

Literature.Title: 3D Structure Elucidation and Appraisal of Mode of Action of a Bacteriocin BaCf3 with Anticancer Potential Produced by Marine Bacillus amyloliquefaciens BTSS3

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Bacillus circulans NCIM 2107(MIC=1.84±0.005µg/ml),Human lung carcinoma A549(IC50=200µg/ml)
